question: At the beginning of the party, there were 55 doctors and 75 engineers. After half an hour, 1/2 of the total number of people left. How many engineers are left if 31 doctors stayed at the party?
answer:
There were a total of 55 doctors + 75 engineers = <<55+75=130>>130 people who attended the party.
After half an hour, 130 people * 1/2 = <<130*1/2=65>>65 people left the party.
This means 130 people - 65 people = <<130-65=65>>65 people stayed.
Out of the 65 who stayed, 65 people - 31 doctors = <<65-31=34>>34 were engineers.
#### 34
